lines: 'Tis true what they say: you are what you eat. Sadly, most folk fail to pay due heed to their diet.
I must confess to being one of them. So engrossed do I become in seeing others fed, I often go long stretches without feeding myself.
The marriage of taste and nourishment has ever posed a challenge to us culinarians. Indeed, foods that are good for the body don't necessarily satisfy the palate.
But with knowledge, we can overcome an ingredient's shortcomings, as you've demonstrated to me on multiple occasions. Your successes have fairly inspired me to explore other possibilities.
...Mind you, this doesn't mean that I've stopped being cross with Master Lyngsath and his little schemes to make me healthy.

obj.n: Une recette qui ne compte pas pour des prunes
La vengeance est un plat qui se mange froid
Sandales bec d'oie en cuir de bouquetin
